label: AB_hP8_186_ab_ab-001
title: Moissanite-4H SiC ($B5$) Structure
comments:
This is one possible stacking (ABAC) for tetrahedral structures. Compare this to \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_cF8_216_a_c-001}{zincblende ($B3$, ABCABC)}, \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_hP4_186_b_b-001}{wurtzite ($B4$, ABABAB)}, \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_hP12_186_a2b_a2b-001}{6H (ABCACB)}, and \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_hR6_160_3a_3a-001}{9R (ABCBCACAB)}. The 4H refers to the fact that there are 4 CSi dimers in a hexagonal unit cell. Zincblende is denoted 3C and wurtzite is 2H. This structure is related to the \href{current_web_home_dir/A_hP4_194_ac-001}{$\alpha$-La (A3') structure} in the same way that zincblende ($B3$) is related to the \href{current_web_home_dir/A_cF4_225_a-001}{fcc ($A1$) lattice}. 
 Space group $P6_{3}mc$ \#186 allows us to take any one of the $z_{i}$ to be zero. In the pictures here we take $z_{2}=0$ for the silicon (2a) site. 
 We did not find an ICSD or CCDC entry for (Bauer, 2001).  The ICSD entry here is from (Thibault, 1944).
